Journal.Title: The Science of the total environment

Article.ArticleTitle: A new-generation 3D ozone FACE (Free Air Controlled Exposure).

AbstractText: To artificially simulate the impacts of ground-level ozone (O<sub>3</sub>) on vegetation, ozone FACE (Free Air Controlled Exposure) systems are increasingly recommended. We describe here a new-generation, three-dimensional ozone FACE, with O<sub>3</sub> diffusion through laser-generated micro-holes, pre-mixing of air and O<sub>3</sub>, O<sub>3</sub> generator with integral oxygen generator, continuous (day/night) exposure and full replication. Based on three O<sub>3</sub> levels and assumptions on the pre-industrial O<sub>3</sub> levels, we describe principles to calculate relative yield/biomass and estimate impacts even at lower-than-ambient O<sub>3</sub> levels. The case study is called FO<sub>3</sub>X, and is at present the only ozone FACE in Mediterranean climate and one of the very few ozone FACEs investigating more than one stressor at a time. The results presented here will give further impulse to the research on O<sub>3</sub> impacts on vegetation all over the world.
